meanings.definition: A small, inflamed swelling on the skin, typically filled with pus.
meanings.sent1: The plook on his face was red and painful.
meanings.sent2: She squeezed the plook on her arm to release the pus.
meanings.sent3: The plook on his nose made him look like a clown.
meanings.sent4: The plook on the tree bark oozed with sticky sap.
meanings.sent5: The plook on the apple was a tiny, rotten spot.

meanings.definition: To develop a plook on the skin.
meanings.sent1: If you keep touching your face, you might plook.
meanings.sent2: After a day in the sun, her skin started to plook.
meanings.sent3: He always seems to plook right before important events.
meanings.sent4: Her worries seemed to plook on her forehead.
meanings.sent5: The stress of the exam caused her to plook.
